title: Ticket #7889: credd sends hup to krb credmon, not oauth, for local issuer scitokens
description:
After changing the code for 8.9.9 to add plumbing for locally issued credentials, I realized the credd is attempting to send the sighup to the Kerberos CredMon and not the OAuth Credmon.

This can be worked around in the config by setting 

SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY_KRB = $(SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY_OAUTH)
This causes the credd to pick up the pid file from the OAuth directory and SIGHUP it correctly.

Code change is to fix the code path that does the "magic" LOCAL:scitokens store cred via krb mechanism to also realize it should HUP the OAuth CredMon, not the Kerberos Credmon.
